originalTitle: Trump's Board of Peace members pledge $7bn in Gaza relief
title: Big Hearts Send Big Help to Friends in Faraway Gaza!
content:
Hello, Little Superheroes!

Hello, my wonderful friends! Your special news reporter from Africa is here! Today, we have some very important news about being kind and helping people. It's like a big hug from far away! We are going to talk about how some kind people want to help other people who live very far from us. It's a story about hope and friendship for everyone.

A Big Promise to Help!

Guess what? Some very, very kind people have made a huge promise! They said they will give a lot of money to help children and families in a place called Gaza. Can you guess how much? It’s not just a little bit, like pocket money. It's a super-duper big amount! They promised seven *billion* dollars! Wow! That's a number so big, it's hard to imagine. It's like having enough money to buy an ice cream for everyone in your town, and then everyone in the next town, and the next, and many, many more towns! This money is special because it is for helping people. It will help them get things they need to live happy and safe lives. This promise means so much to the people who need help. Did you know? A *billion* is a very, very big number! It's one thousand millions! That's a lot of zeros, like 1,000,000,000! Imagine that!

Who Are These Kind Helpers?

So, who are these amazing people making such a big promise? They are friends who work with a special person called Mr. Trump. Mr. Trump used to be the president of a big country called America. He has a group of friends, like a special team, and they want to help make the world a more peaceful place. We can call them "Mr. Trump's Peace Team." They meet together to talk about how they can help people get along and stop fighting. They want everyone to be happy and safe. These kind helpers believe that everyone deserves to live in peace. They want to make sure children can play and learn without being scared.

Where is Gaza?

Gaza is a place that is very far from us, across the big blue ocean. It's a land where many families live, just like you live with your family. But sometimes, people in Gaza have a hard time. Sometimes, there are problems, and it makes life difficult for them. They might not have enough food to eat, or clean water to drink, or safe homes to live in. Imagine not having a comfy bed or a warm meal. That's why the kind helpers want to send so much money to Gaza. They want to make life better for the children and their families there. They want to help them build new homes and schools. Did you know? Gaza is a part of a place called the Middle East. It's a very old place with lots of history! It has hot weather, just like some parts of Africa.

What Will All This Money Do?

Seven billion dollars! That's so much! What will it do? Well, it will do so many wonderful things! * **Food for hungry tummies:** It will buy lots and lots of healthy food so that no child goes to bed hungry. Imagine big bags of rice, tasty beans, and fresh fruits and vegetables for everyone! * **Medicine to make you feel better:** When people get sick, this money will help them get the right medicine to feel strong again. It will help doctors and nurses care for everyone, so they can get better quickly. * **Safe homes for families:** Many homes in Gaza might be broken. This money will help build new, strong homes where families can live safely and sleep soundly. Every family needs a safe place to call home. * **Schools for learning:** Every child deserves to go to school! This money will help build new schools and buy books and pencils so children can learn and grow their amazing minds. Learning is so important! * **Clean water to drink:** Everyone needs clean water to drink every day. This money can help get clean water pipes and wells so people don't get sick from dirty water. Clean water keeps us healthy and strong. * **Maybe even toys!** Because every child should have time to play and be happy! Toys help children learn and smile. This big help means that children in Gaza can have a better chance to be healthy, go to school, and live in peace. It’s like sending a giant box of happiness and safety from kind people far away!

Wishing for Peace

Mr. Trump and his Peace Team have a big wish. They wish for peace in Gaza. What does "peace" mean? It means no more fighting. It means everyone being friends and working together. Mr. Trump hopes that groups of people who might cause trouble or fight will decide to stop. He hopes they will put down their fighting tools and talk instead of fighting. It’s like when you have an argument with a friend, and you decide to talk about it and say sorry, instead of shouting. He hopes everyone will choose to be kind to each other and live in friendship. Did you know? When there is peace, people can build beautiful things, like parks and libraries, and children can play outside safely without any worries!

Sometimes Peace is Tricky

But sometimes, making peace is a little tricky, like solving a puzzle. Mr. Trump thinks that maybe the groups who cause trouble will stop. But it's not always easy. Sometimes, these groups might try to get strong again. It’s like if you tell your naughty puppy not to chew your shoe, but then when you turn your back, they try again! It takes a lot of trying and patience. So, even with all this big help and big wishes for peace, everyone has to keep working hard. It’s like working hard at school to learn something new. We all need to keep hoping and trying our best for peace. But the good news is that many people want to help and never give up on the idea of peace for everyone. The help they are giving, this big money, is a very important step towards making things better for children and families.

Why is Helping So Important?

Helping others is one of the kindest things we can do. When we help someone, it makes them feel happy and safe. And guess what? It makes us feel happy too! When Mr. Trump's Peace Team helps people in Gaza, they are showing that even if people live very far away, they are still part of our big world family. We should always try to be kind to everyone, no matter where they live or what they look like. Imagine if you fell down and someone helped you up. That's how people in Gaza will feel when they get this big help. They will feel cared for and loved, knowing that people from far away are thinking of them. Did you know? Helping others can make your heart feel warm and fuzzy inside! It's true! It's like sunshine inside your heart.

Let's All Hope for a Bright Future!

So, my amazing little friends, this is wonderful news about kindness and hope. Kind people are sending lots and lots of help to children and families in Gaza. They are hoping for peace and a bright future for everyone there. Let's all think good thoughts and hope that this big promise brings lots of happiness and peace to Gaza. Remember, even little acts of kindness from you, like sharing a toy or helping a friend, can make a big difference in our world. You are all amazing!
summary: Kind people working with Mr. Trump have promised seven billion dollars to help families and children in Gaza get food, medicine, and homes, hoping for lasting peace in that faraway place.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows that many people care about others and want to help children and families in a faraway place have a safer, happier life with enough food, clean water, and a chance to go to school, making the world a kinder place for everyone.

originalTitle: Forest 'express themselves' as Pereira message hits home
title: Forest 'express themselves' as Pereira message hits home
content: Vitor Pereira asks his Nottingham Forest players to "express themselves" prior to their commanding victory at Fenerbahce in the first leg of their Europa League knockout round play-off tie.

originalTitle: 'Anyone found guilty of racism should not be in the game'
title: 'Anyone found guilty of racism should not be in the game'
content: Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior says anyone found guilty of racist behaviour in football "shouldn't be in the game".

originalTitle: The eerie similarities between Arsenal's 2007-8 collapse and now
title: The eerie similarities between Arsenal's 2007-8 collapse and now
content: Arsenal's disappointing 2-2 draw at Wolves on Wednesday has similarities to what happened to the Gunners 18 years ago.
